properties.areaDesc: Foster; McIntosh; La Moure; Stutsman; Burleigh; Logan; Emmons; Dickey; Kidder
properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 3:12AM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow
expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch.
Visibility reduced below one mile in areas of blowing snow.
Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
wind chills as low as 40 below zero expected.

* WHERE...Foster, Stutsman, LaMoure, Dickey, Kidder, Logan,
McIntosh, Burleigh, and Emmons counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this
evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening
to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions will impact the morning commute. The dangerously
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 10 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near whiteout conditions are likely in open
areas of the James River Valley this morning.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while outdoors. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and
gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY
